intro: Caiophora scabra, commonly known as the rough-stemmed caiophora, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
